<small>Aramaic form: **<big>[[H1668|דָּא]]</big>**</small>
 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי‎</span> **particle of relation**, ==who, which, that==, used also as **mark of genitive** and **conjunction** ==that, because== (Aramaic of Nineveh, Babylonian, Zinjirli, Nerab, Cilicia, Têma, Egypt, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ןי‎</span> ([[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>267. 446</sup> RES<sup>361</sup> [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>Pap. A 2</sup> +); Nabataean, Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎די‎</span>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דְּ‎</span> (except in compounds, as <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּילִי‎</span> ***mine***, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּילֵיהּ‎</span> ***his***); Samaritan <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***za:*** of same origin as Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***possessor of*** [compare below Biblical Hebrew <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎זֶה‎</span>]. Properly a demonstrative ***that*** [compare <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎זֶה‎</span>; in Ethiopic ***ze*** is 'this', ***za*** 'which']; but this being referred by usage to something preceding becomes equivalent to the relative ***who, which***, used, however, more widely than Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span>); — 

**1.** as **rel.** ***who, which*** (construed like <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span>): a. [[Jer.10.11|Jer 10:11]]; [[Dan.2.11|Dan 2:11]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי מְדָֽרְהוֺן‎</span> ***whose*** dwelling, v[[Dan.2.24|Dan 2:24]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי מַנִּי מַלְבָּא‎</span> ***whom*** the king had appointed, v[[Dan.2.26|Dan 2:26]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי שְׁמֵהּ בּ‎</span> ***whose*** name was B., [[Dan.4.5|Dan 4:5]]; [[Dan.5.12|Dan 5:12]]; [[Dan.5.23|Dan 5:23]], etc.; = ***that which*** [[Dan.2.23|Dan 2:23]] = ***him that*** [[Ezra.7.25|Ezra 7:25]]; [[Ezra.6.15|Ezra 6:15]]; [[Dan.7.17|Dan 7:17]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּת אִנוּן אַרְבַּע‎</span> ***which*** are four (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִנּוּן‎</span>). Following pronoun of 2 person (compare <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span> **3**), [[Dan.2.37|Dan 2:37]] thou, O king ..., <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דִּי ֗֗֗ יְהַב לָח‎</span> ***to whom***... hath given, [[Dan.4.19|Dan 4:19]]; [[Dan.4.6|Dan 4:6]] ***as to whom*** I know, etc. (compare <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span> **4 d** ***end***). Sq. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תַּמָּה‎</span> = ***where*** [[Ezra.6.1|Ezra 6:1]], so <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי‎</span> alone [[Ezra.6.3|Ezra 6:3]]; [[Dan.2.38|Dan 2:38]] of time, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בְּעִדָּנָא דִּי‎</span> at the time ***when***, etc., [[Dan.3.5|Dan 3:5]]; [[Dan.3.15|Dan 3:15]]. With the predicate an infinitive with <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְ‎</span>, [[Dan.6.9|Dan 6:9]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כְּתָבָא דִּי לָא לְהַשְׁנָיָה‎</span> ***which ***is not to be changed, [[Ezra.6.8|Ezra 6:8]] a place- or other determination, [[Dan.3.20|Dan 3:20]] valiant men <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בְחֵילֵהּ‎</span> ***that*** were in his army, [[Dan.5.2|Dan 5:2]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵיכְלָא דִּי בִירוּשְׁלֵב‎</span>, [[Dan.7.20|Dan 7:20]]; [[Ezra.4.24|Ezra 4:24]]; [[Ezra.5.6|Ezra 5:6]]; [[Ezra.6.2|Ezra 6:2]]; [[Ezra.6.6|Ezra 6:6]] compare [[Dan.2.25|Dan 2:25]]; [[Dan.5.13|Dan 5:13]]; [[Dan.7.7|Dan 7:7]]; [[Ezra.7.23|Ezra 7:23]]. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי לָא‎</span> = ***without***, [[Ezra.6.9|Ezra 6:9]]; [[Ezra.7.22|Ezra 7:22]] (so <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דְּלָא‎</span> [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] [[Gen.15.2|Gen 15:2]]; [[Exod.21.11|Exod 21:11]]); compare [[Dan.2.34|Dan 2:34]]; [[Dan.2.45|Dan 2:45]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מָן דִּי‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מָה דִּי‎</span> (compare in late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מַהשֶּֿׁ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מַה‎</span> **1 e** ***b***) ***whoever, whatever***, so [[Dan.3.6|Dan 3:6]]; [[Dan.3.11|Dan 3:11]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎יִפֵּל ָ(מןדִּֿילָֿא‎</span> ***whoever*** does not fall down, [[Dan.4.14|Dan 4:14]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְמָן דִּי יִצְבֵּא‎</span> to ***whomsoever*** he willeth, v.[[Dan.4.22|Dan 4:22]] v.[[Dan.4.29|Dan 4:29]]; [[Dan.5.21|Dan 5:21]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מָה דִי‎</span> ***whatever*** (or simply ***what***), [[Dan.2.28|Dan 2:28]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מָה דִּי לֶהֱוֵא‎</span> what will be, v[[Dan.2.29|Dan 2:29]] v[[Dan.2.29|Dan 2:29]] v[[Dan.2.45|Dan 2:45]]; [[Ezra.6.8|Ezra 6:8]]; [[Ezra.7.18|Ezra 7:18]]. — compare [[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 103.</sup> 

**2.** as **mark of the genitive**, [[Dan.2.15|Dan 2:15]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שׁליטא די מלכא‎</span> properly the captain, ***that of*** the king = ***the king's captain*** (a genuine Aramaic idiom: so [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דְּ‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> constantly), v[[Dan.2.19|Dan 2:19]] v[[Dan.2.25|Dan 2:25]] v[[Dan.2.49|Dan 2:49]] + often: the substantive in such cases may be either in the emphatic state (determined), as ll. cc. [[Ezra.4.15|Ezra 4:15]]; [[Ezra.5.2|Ezra 5:2]], etc., or in the absolute state (undetermined), [[Dan.5.5|Dan 5:5]]; [[Dan.7.4|Dan 7:4]]; [[Dan.7.9|Dan 7:9]]; [[Dan.7.10|Dan 7:10]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נְהַר דִּי נוּר‎</span>; or it may have a pleonastic suffix, [[Dan.2.20|Dan 2:20]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שְׁמֵהּ דִּי אֱלָהָא‎</span> literally his name, ***that of*** God = ***God's name***, v[[Dan.2.44|Dan 2:44]]; [[Dan.3.8|Dan 3:8]]; [[Dan.3.25|Dan 3:25]]; [[Dan.3.26|Dan 3:26]]; [[Dan.4.23|Dan 4:23]], etc. (so also [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] Syriac). To circumscribe an adjective, especially in specification of the ***material:*** [[Dan.2.38|Dan 2:38]] thou art <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎רֵאשָׁה דִּי דַהֲבָא‎</span> the head of gold, v[[Dan.2.39|Dan 2:39]]; [[Dan.3.1|Dan 3:1]]; [[Dan.5.7|Dan 5:7]]; [[Dan.5.16|Dan 5:16]]; [[Ezra.5.14|Ezra 5:14]]; [[Ezra.6.4|Ezra 6:4]] +; as predicate [[Dan.2.32|Dan 2:32]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎רֵאשֵׁהּ דִּידְֿהַב טָב‎</span> his head (was) ***of*** fine gold, v[[Dan.2.33|Dan 2:33]]; [[Dan.7.19|Dan 7:19]] with a pronoun [[Dan.2.20|Dan 2:20]] wisdom and might <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּילֵֿהּ הִיא‎</span> are ***his***; compare [[Dan.6.27|Dan 6:27]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎וּמַלְכוּתֵהּ דִּילָֿא תִתְחַבַּל‎</span> his kingdom (is one) which shall not be destroyed, [[Dan.7.14|Dan 7:14]]. — See further [[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 81.</sup> 

**3.** as **conjunction** (compare <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span> **8**): 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** ***that (quod)***, after verbs of knowing, [[Dan.2.8|Dan 2:8]]; [[Dan.2.9|Dan 2:9]], seeing [[Dan.2.45|Dan 2:45]]; [[Dan.3.27|Dan 3:27]], hearing [[Dan.5.14|Dan 5:14]], etc.; introducing the subject of a sentence, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְדִיעַ ֗֗֗ דִּי ֗֗֗ ‎</span> [[Dan.3.18|Dan 3:18]]; [[Ezra.4.13|Ezra 4:13]]; [[Dan.2.47|Dan 2:47]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִןקְֿשֹׁט דִּי ֗֗֗ ‎</span> True is it ***that . . .*** (compare <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אָמְנָם כִּי‎</span> [[Job.12.2|Job 12:2]]). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** = ***in that, inasmuch as, whereas:*** [[Dan.2.41|Dan 2:41]] and ***whereas*** (<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי‎</span>) thou sawest, etc. . . . it shall be adivided kingdom, v[[Dan.2.43|Dan 2:43]]; [[Dan.4.20|Dan 4:20]]; [[Dan.4.23|Dan 4:23]] as a connecting link$ = ***seeing that, because, for*** (compare <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span> **8 c**) [[Dan.2.9|Dan 2:9]]; [[Dan.2.20|Dan 2:20]]b; [[Dan.2.23|Dan 2:23]]b; [[Dan.2.47|Dan 2:47]]b; [[Dan.4.15|Dan 4:15]]; [[Dan.6.24|Dan 6:24]]b. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** ***that (ut)***, after verbs of asking [[Dan.2.16|Dan 2:16]], commanding [[Dan.3.10|Dan 3:10]]; [[Dan.3.29|Dan 3:29]], expressing a purpose [[Dan.4.3|Dan 4:3]]; [[Dan.5.15|Dan 5:15]]; [[Ezra.4.15|Ezra 4:15]]; [[Ezra.6.10|Ezra 6:10]] +; <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי לָא‎</span> ***that not (ne)*** [[Dan.2.18|Dan 2:18]]; [[Dan.3.28|Dan 3:28]]; [[Dan.6.18|Dan 6:18]] (on <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי לְמָה‎</span> ***lest*** [[Ezra.7.23|Ezra 7:23]], see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה‎</span>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** prefixed to direct narr. (like <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כִּי‎</span> **1 b**, and sometimes <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span> **8 a** <span class="bdbLangGreek">γ</span>, and <span class="bdbLangGreek">ὅτι</span> ***recitativum***), [[Dan.2.25|Dan 2:25]] and said thus unto him <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּיהַֿשְׁכַּחַת‎</span> (that) I have found, etc., [[Dan.5.7|Dan 5:7]]; [[Dan.6.6|Dan 6:6]]; [[Dan.6.14|Dan 6:14]]. 

**4.** with prepositions and other prefixes: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כְּ דִי‎</span> (like Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּאֲשֶׁר‎</span>; so Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כזי‎</span>, Palmyrene, Nabataean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כדי‎</span>, [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>293</sup> [[BDB#Cook|SAC]]<sup>G1 62, 63</sup> [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>369 b RES:361</sup>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כַּד‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); ***a according as***, [[Dan.2.43|Dan 2:43]] ***b. so soon as, when***, [[Dan.3.7|Dan 3:7]]; [[Dan.5.20|Dan 5:20]]; [[Dan.6.11|Dan 6:11]]; [[Dan.6.15|Dan 6:15]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִןדִּֿי‎</span>: ***a. because that***, [[Dan.3.22|Dan 3:22]]; [[Ezra.5.12|Ezra 5:12]] (compare <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מֵאֲשֶׁר‎</span> [[Isa.43.4|Isa 43:4]]); ***b. from*** (the time) ***that, after (ex quo)***, [[Dan.4.23|Dan 4:23]]; [[Ezra.4.23|Ezra 4:23]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עַד דִּי‎</span> ***until***, [[Dan.2.9|Dan 2:9]]; [[Dan.2.34|Dan 2:34]]; [[Dan.4.30|Dan 4:30]]; [[Dan.7.22|Dan 7:22]] = ***ere that*** [[Dan.6.25|Dan 6:25]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עַל דִּי‎</span> [[Dan.3.19|Dan 3:19]] is not a conjunction, but means ***above that which ...*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** for <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עַל דִּבְרַת דִּי‎</span> and <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כָּלקֳֿבֵל דִּי‎</span> see [ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דִּבְרָה‎</span>] and <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קֳבֵל‎</span>.
